sourcesContent:
import React, { Component } from 'react'; import './centralized.style.css'; class centralized extends Component { render() { return (

Centralised Distribution System

Better control:

  • One of the advantages of having a centralized distribution is to have better control. Organizations setup central stores which are responsible for all activities and transport their inventory as and when required to other stores which are usually attached to the production capacities located in different locations.

Inventory management:

  • Inventory can be as minimum as material ordered based on the requirement of all other attached parties. The material can also be ruled out to and from the attached central stores. This is especially so in the case of tools, fixtures, equipment and spares.

Reduced cost:

  • By choosing to centralize warehousing and distribution, the need to pay rent or utility and incidental expenditures for different warehouses is reduced. The need to spend more on new equipment and technologies for each warehouse is also eliminated.

Inventory management:

  • Inventory can be as minimum as material ordered based on the requirement of all other attached parties. The material can also be ruled out to and from the attached central stores. This is especially so in the case of tools, fixtures, equipment and spares.

); } } export default centralized;
